intro: Matelea brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful if ingested. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged oppositely along the stem. Matelea brasiliensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, humid environments.
